title: Comfort Found in Good Old Books
description: Comfort Found in Good Old Books is a book written by George Hamlin Fitch. In this book, the author talks about the importance of reading classic literature and how it can provide comfort and solace in difficult times. Fitch shares his personal experiences and reflections on various classic works of literature, including Shakespeare, Dickens, and Thoreau. He discusses how these books have helped him navigate through life's challenges and how they continue to offer wisdom and insight to readers today. The book is a tribute to the enduring power of classic literature and a reminder of the comfort and inspiration it can provide. It is a must-read for anyone who loves books and seeks solace in their pages.1911. Fitch writes in the These short essays on the best old books in the world were inspired by the sudden death of an only son, without whom I had not thought life worth living. To tide me over the first weeks of bitter grief I plunged into this work of reviewing the great books from the Bible to the works of the eighteenth century writers. The suggestion came from many readers who were impressed by the fact that in the darkest hour of sorrow my only comfort came from the habit of reading, which Gibbon declared he would not exchange for the wealth of the Indies. If these essays induce any one to cultivate the reading habit, which has been so great a solace to me in time of trouble, then I shall feel fully repaid.
